ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Chains Reliability
ygData.msgSnippet: Yes...and I pointed out that Chains has that advantage when twisted in combat. But I think that the original post focused on the effectiveness of Chains versus
ygData.messageBody:
Yes...and I pointed out that Chains has that advantage when twisted in
combat. But I think that the original post focused on the effectiveness of
Chains versus Snare/Root for purposes of preventing a mob from escaping in a
dungeon where said mob might pull a train back. Obviously, the attack speed
of an escaping mob isn't much of a concern, so I compared Chains to
Snare/Root purely on a "mob-stopping" basis.

> From: "Lyrnia Jongleur" <Lyrnia@...>
>
> Actually, if the bard knows what they're doing, chains is BETTER
> Than snare. Snare doesn't have a 30% attack speed de-buff.
